Class GameScreen

java.lang.Object
org.newdawn.slick.state.BasicGameState
GameScreen
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.newdawn.slick.ControlledInputReciever, org.newdawn.slick.ControllerListener, org.newdawn.slick.InputListener, org.newdawn.slick.KeyListener, org.newdawn.slick.MouseListener, org.newdawn.slick.state.GameState
public class GameScreen
extends org.newdawn.slick.state.BasicGameState
The GameScreen runs the game and has the logic to play the game.

This keeps track of all the internal game logic due to the fact that we cannot access the pixel values. This also does all of the drawing using the Slick2D library.

See Also:
BasicGameState

  • Method Details

    • init

      public void init​(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gameContainer, org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame sbg) throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
      Uses the Slick2D BasicGameState to create the game. Init is used 1 time for intialization of Images and positions of the rewards, stationary enemy, barriers and bonus rewards.
      Parameters:
      gameContainer - uses slick2D to get our current game container.
      sbg - has functionality for the StateBasedGame.
      Throws:
      org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - throws any exceptions that come from drawing things onto the screen.

    • update

      public void update​(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gameContainer, org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame sbg, int delta) throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
      Deals with updates to the game for every frame update. The player and the enemy can both only update every 4th tick or every 8th of a second real time. The tick will then reset after each time it gets to 4. Update is also use to check when the game should move into the pause, failure or victory states.
      Parameters:
      gameContainer - uses slick2D to get our current game container.
      sbg - has functionality for the StateBasedGame.
      Throws:
      org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - throws any exceptions that come from drawing things onto the screen.

    • render

      public void render​(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gameContainer, org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame sbg, org.newdawn.slick.Graphics graphics) throws org.newdawn.slick.SlickException
      Handles the drawing of any items on the screen. This is done after update so it will draw the updates that are made.
      Parameters:
      gameContainer - uses slick2D to get our current game container.
      sbg - has functionality for the StateBasedGame.
      Throws:
      org.newdawn.slick.SlickException - throws any exceptions that come from drawing things onto the screen.

    • getID

      public int getID()
      Returns the id of the state.
      Specified by:
      getID in interface org.newdawn.slick.state.GameState
      Specified by:
      getID in class org.newdawn.slick.state.BasicGameState
      Returns:
      the id of the state.

    • updateGame

      public void updateGame()
      Function to update the game based on player input. Then it wil check if the player if moving into a tile that is not a wall. After that if the tile is >2 then that means it will require some kind of collision handling to happen before the player can move.
      See Also:
      Player, Tile
